intro: Sitanion glabrum, commonly known as the smooth sitanion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Sitanion glabrum is native to parts of North America and is often found in disturbed or sunny environments.
